sen.j: 鼓楼（ころう）は、古来中華人民共和国及び、その文化影響圏の城内・都市内・宗教施設敷地内に建てられる。
sen.e: From ancient times ko-ro towers were built inside castles, cities or religious institution sites in the People's Republic of China and the areas influenced by the Chinese culture.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: From ancient times, drum towers (ko-ro towers) were built inside castles, cities and the sites of religious institutions in the People's Republic of China and areas influenced by the Chinese culture.
sen.cmt: times の後をカンマで区切り、or を and に修正しました。ko-ro towers を drum towers (ko-ro towers) に修正しました。 religious institution sites を the sites of religious institutions に修正し、areas の前の the を削除しました。
sen.e: From ancient times, drum towers (ko-ro towers) were built inside castles, cities and the sites of religious institutions in the People's Republic of China and areas influenced by the Chinese culture.

sen.j: 時報や合図を発する楼閣形式の建物のこと。
sen.e: A ko-ro tower is a multi-storied building informing the time or signaling other information.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The drum tower is a multi-storied building designed to inform people of the time or to give signals.
sen.cmt: 文頭の A を The に修正し、informing 以下を修正しました。ko-ro tower を drum tower に修正しました。
sen.e: The drum tower is a multi-storied building designed to inform people of the time or to give signals.

sen.j: 主に内部には太鼓が設置されている。
sen.e: Normally a drum is set inside the tower.
Normally a drum is set inside the tower.
Normally a drum is set inside the tower.

sen.j: 太鼓楼（たいころう）などとも呼ばれている。
sen.e: Ko-ro towers are also called 'taiko-ro towers.'
Drum towers are also called taiko-ro in Japanese.
Drum towers are also called taiko-ro in Japanese.

sen.j: 類例に鐘楼がある。
sen.e: A sho-ro tower (bell tower) is similar to a ko-ro tower.
A sho-ro tower (bell tower) is similar to a ko-ro tower.
A sho-ro tower (bell tower) is similar to a ko-ro tower.

sen.j: 鐘楼も時報のための建物であり、中国の都城では対に造られる例が多い。
sen.e: Sho-ro towers were also for signaling the time and many of them are built in pairs in Chinese provincial capitals.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Bell towers (sho-ro towers) were also designed to give time signals and many of them were built in pairs in Chinese provincial capitals.
sen.cmt: sho-ro tower を bell tower (sho-ro tower) に修正しました。signaling the time を designed to give time signals に修正しました。are を were 修正しました。
sen.e: Bell towers (sho-ro towers) were also designed to give time signals and many of them were built in pairs in Chinese provincial capitals.

sen.j: 通常は東に鐘楼、西に鼓楼を置いた。
sen.e: A sho-ro tower was normally built in the east and a ko-ro tower in the west.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: A bell tower was normally built in the east and a drum tower in the west.
sen.cmt: sho-ro tower を bell tower に、ko-ro tower を drum tower に修正しました。
sen.e: A bell tower was normally built in the east and a drum tower in the west.

sen.j: 早朝に鐘を鳴らし、夕べには鼓を撃って「晨鐘暮鼓」と称した。
sen.e: The bell was rung early in the morning and the drum was beaten in the evening and this was referred to as 'shisho boko' (morning bell and evening drum).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処「撃って」は「打って」の誤りと考えて訳しました。
sen.e: The bell was rung early in the morning and the drum was beaten in the evening; this was referred to as 'shinsho boko' (morning bell and evening drum).
sen.cmt: shisho boko' を 'shinsho boko' に修正しました。And を削除してカンマで区切りました。
sen.e: The bell was rung early in the morning and the drum was beaten in the evening; this was referred to as 'shinsho boko' (morning bell and evening drum).

sen.j: 北京鐘鼓楼（zh北京鼓樓和鐘樓、enBeijing Gulou and Zhonglou）のように北に鐘楼・南に鼓楼を配置したものや、山海関鐘鼓楼のように一体の楼閣である場合もある。
sen.e: As can be seen in the shoko-ro towers in Beijing (Beijing Gulou and Zhonglou), some have a sho-ro tower in the north and a ko-ro tower in the south while others have shoko-ro towers in a single building as in Shanhaiguan shoko-ro tower.
sen.cmt: 中国語での名称は必要ないと考えましたので、（）内は北京鐘鼓楼の英名称だけにしました。
sen.e: As can be seen in the bell and drum towers in Beijing (Beijing Gulou and Zhonglou), some have a bell tower in the north and a drum tower in the south while others have bell and drum towers in a single building like in Shanhaiguan shodrum tower.
sen.cmt: shoko-ro towers を bell and drum tower に、sho-ro tower を bell tower に、ko-ro tower を drum tower に修正しました。as を like に修正しました。
sen.e: As can be seen in the bell and drum towers in Beijing (Beijing Gulou and Zhonglou), some have a bell tower in the north and a drum tower in the south while others have bell and drum towers in a single building like in Shanhaiguan shodrum tower.

tit.e: Ko-ro Tower in the Nanjing Castle
The Drum Tower in Nanjing Castle
tit.cmt: ko-ro tower を drum tower に修正し、固有名詞であることから、下記を参照して語頭を大文字にしました。http://www.chinatravel.net/china-attractions/Nanjing/searchresult-64.html Nanjing Castle の前の the を削除しました。
tit.e: The Drum Tower in Nanjing Castle

sen.j: 南京城の鼓楼（ころう）は南京市鼓楼区 (南京市)の中心に位置している。
sen.e: A ko-ro tower in the Nanjing Castle is located in the center of Ko-ro Tower Ward, Nanjing City.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処（南京市）は除いて訳しました。
sen.e: The Drum Tower in Nanjing Castle is located in the center of Gulou district, Nanjing City.
sen.cmt: the を削除しました。ko-ro tower を drum tower に修正し、固有名詞であることから、下記を参照して語頭を大文字にしました。http://www.chinatravel.net/china-attractions/Nanjing/searchresult-64.html在所名を中国語の英語表記に変更しました。
sen.e: The Drum Tower in Nanjing Castle is located in the center of Gulou district, Nanjing City.

sen.j: 明の洪武15年（1382年）に建てられ、昼夜の時報や王を迎えるときに使われた。
sen.e: It was built in 1382 during the Ming Dynasty and used for signaling the times of day and night and for welcoming kings.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It was built in 1382 during the Ming Dynasty and used for signalling the times of day and night and for welcoming kings.
sen.cmt: signaling を signalｌing に修正しました。
sen.e: It was built in 1382 during the Ming Dynasty and used for signalling the times of day and night and for welcoming kings.

sen.j: 現在は鼓楼公園として整備され、公園に隣接する区域は鼓楼広場となっている。
sen.e: Now the area is a park, and the Ko-ro Tower Park and the site adjacent to the park have become Ko-ro Tower Square; a public square.
Now the area is a park, and the Drum Tower (Gulou) Park and the site adjacent to the park is Drum Tower Square; a public square.
sen.cmt: 「鼓楼公園」の英語名について、下記を参考にして修正しました。http://www.china-tour.cn/Nanjing/Drum-Tower.htmhave become を is に修正しました。
sen.e: Now the area is a park, and the Drum Tower (Gulou) Park and the site adjacent to the park is Drum Tower Square; a public square.

sen.j: 公園は800 - 1730（2004年現在）まで開園され、入場は無料であるが、鼓楼の登閣は有料（5元（2004年現在）である。
sen.e: The park is open from 8 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. (as of 2004) and is free to enter but a fee (five yuan as of 2004) is charged to climb the ko-ro tower.
The park is open from 8 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. (as of 2004) and is free to enter, but a fee (five yuan as of 2004) is charged to climb the drum tower.
sen.cmt: カンマを追記しました。中国の鼓楼に関しては、drum tower に修正しました。
sen.e: The park is open from 8 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. (as of 2004) and is free to enter, but a fee (five yuan as of 2004) is charged to climb the drum tower.

sen.j: 鼓楼の2階には石碑、鐘、太鼓がある。
sen.e: There is a stone monument, a bell and a drum on the second floor of the ko-ro tower.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: There is a stone monument, a bell and a drum on the second floor of the Drum Tower.
sen.cmt: ko-ro tower を Drum Tower に修正しました。
sen.e: There is a stone monument, a bell and a drum on the second floor of the Drum Tower.

sen.j: 別途料金を支払えば鐘と太鼓を鳴らすことができる。
sen.e: You can ring the bell and beat the drum for an additional fee.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: You can ring the bell and beat the drum for an additional fee.
You can ring the bell and beat the drum for an additional fee.

sen.j: 3階には昔の鼓楼の写真が展示されており昔の南京を伺うことができる。
sen.e: The old photographs of the ko-ro tower are displayed on the third floor and recall Nanjing in the past.
Old photographs of the Drum Tower are displayed on the third floor, which recall Nanjing in the past.
sen.cmt: the を削除しました。ko-ro tower を Drum Tower に修正しました。and を , which に修正しました。
sen.e: Old photographs of the Drum Tower are displayed on the third floor, which recall Nanjing in the past.

sen.j: 最寄り駅は南京地下鉄一号線、鼓楼・農業銀行駅。
sen.e: The closest subway station is Ko-ro Tower, Agricultural Bank Station on the Nanjing Subway System Line Number 1.
The closest subway station is Drum Tower and Agricultural Bank Station on Nanjing Subway Line 1.
sen.cmt: ko-ro tower を Drum Tower に修正し、 下記を参照してSystem を削除しました。Nanjing の前のtheを削除しました。http://www.travelchinaguide.com/cityguides/jiangsu/nanjing/metro-subway-map.htm
sen.e: The closest subway station is Drum Tower and Agricultural Bank Station on Nanjing Subway Line 1.

sen.j: 日本でも、太鼓楼として寺院や神社などの宗教施設敷地内に見ることができる。
sen.e: In Japan too ko-ro towers, referred to as taiko-ro tower, can be seen inside religious institutions such as temples and shrines.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Also in Japan, drum towers referred to as taiko-ro tower can be seen inside religious institutions such as temples and shrines.
Also in Japan, drum towers referred to as taiko-ro tower can be seen inside religious institutions such as temples and shrines.

sen.j: 鐘楼と対に造られるか、どちらか一方のみであることがある。
sen.e: Taiko-ro towers are built in a pair together with a sho-ro tower or sometimes only one of them is built on the site.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In some cases taiko-ro towers and bell towers are built together and in other cases built by themselves.
In some cases taiko-ro towers and bell towers are built together and in other cases built by themselves.

sen.j: 古来の城や都市にあった太鼓櫓もそれに類似する。
sen.e: Taiko yagura (drum towers) in ancient castles and cities are similar to taiko-ro towers.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Taiko yagura (drum towers) in ancient castles and cities are similar to taiko-ro towers.
Taiko yagura (drum towers) in ancient castles and cities are similar to taiko-ro towers.

sen.j: しかし、太鼓櫓という場合は、簡易なものも含む。
sen.e: However taiko yagura include simple structures.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, taiko yagura includes the ones with simple structures.
sen.cmt: includes the ones with に修正しました。
sen.e: However, taiko yagura includes the ones with simple structures.

sen.j: 建物は多層建築として、外部に音が出るように開口部を大きくするか、柱と欄干のみの開放的な造りにすることがある。
sen.e: The buildings are multi-storied, and in order for the sound to go outwards their openings are wide or sometimes they have an open structure with only columns and rails.
The buildings are multi-storied, and in order for the sound to go outwards their openings are wide or sometimes they have an open structure with only columns and rails.
The buildings are multi-storied, and in order for the sound to go outwards their openings are wide or sometimes they have an open structure with only columns and rails.

sen.j: 太鼓櫓（たいこやぐら）は寺院の鼓楼と同じ役割を持つ建物で、常時は日の出と日暮れの開門の時刻を知らせた。
sen.e: A taiko yagura was a building which had the same role as a ko-ro tower in a temple and which normally informed the time of gate openings at sunrise and sunset.
The taiko yagura was a building which had the same role as a drum tower in a temple and which normally announced the time of gate openings at sunrise and sunset.
sen.cmt: A を The に、informed を announced に修正しました。
sen.e: The taiko yagura was a building which had the same role as a drum tower in a temple and which normally announced the time of gate openings at sunrise and sunset.

sen.j: 城郭においては必ずあり、同様のものに鐘櫓がある。
sen.e: All castles had a taiko yagura and a kane yagura (bell tower), which was similar.
All castles had a taiko yagura, and a kane yagura (bell tower) was similar to the taiko yagura.
All castles had a taiko yagura, and a kane yagura (bell tower) was similar to the taiko yagura.

sen.j: 多重の楼閣建築であることが多く、姫路城のように平櫓であることは少ない。
sen.e: Many taiko yagura are multi-storied, so a one-story turret like the Himeji-jo Castle is rare.
Many taiko yagura are multi-storied, and a one-storey turret such as the one in Himeji-jo Castle is rare.
sen.cmt: so を and に修正しました。Story を storey に、like をsuch as に修正しました。the one in を追記し、Himeji-jo Castle の前の the は削除しました。
sen.e: Many taiko yagura are multi-storied, and a one-storey turret such as the one in Himeji-jo Castle is rare.

sen.j: 1重目を通常の櫓と同じように造り、2重目は窓を大きくし、太鼓が吊るしてあった。
sen.e: The first story was made in the same way as a usual tower and the second story had large windows and a hanging drum.
The first storey was made in the same way as a normal turret and the second storey had large windows and a hanging drum.
sen.cmt: story を storey に、usual tower を normal turret に修正しました。
sen.e: The first storey was made in the same way as a normal turret and the second storey had large windows and a hanging drum.

sen.j: 装飾的に造ることがあり、開口に華頭窓を用いたり、欄干を廻られせたものもある。
sen.e: Taiko yagura are sometimes made decoratively such as using kato-mado windows (pointed arch or bell-shaped windows) or surrounded with parapets.
Taiko yagura are sometimes made decoratively; using kato-mado windows (pointed arch or bell-shaped windows) or surrounded with parapets.

sen.e: Taiko yagura are sometimes made decoratively; using kato-mado windows (pointed arch or bell-shaped windows) or surrounded with parapets.

sen.j: 現在、現存する太鼓櫓としては、姫路城（平櫓のもの）のものと、掛川城のもの、復元されたものでは広島城のものなどがある。
sen.e: Examples of existing taiko yagura include those in the Himeji-jo Castle (one-story turret) and the Kakegawa-jo Castle and a restored one in the Hiroshima-jo Castle.
Examples of existing taiko yagura include those in Himeji-jo Castle (one-storey turret) and Kakegawa-jo Castle as well as in Hiroshima-jo Castle, which was restored.

sen.e: Examples of existing taiko yagura include those in Himeji-jo Castle (one-storey turret) and Kakegawa-jo Castle as well as in Hiroshima-jo Castle, which was restored.
